What is B Voc Software Development?

B Voc or Bachelor of Vocational Studies in Software Development is an undergraduate program which is of 3-year duration. This program improves the skills of the candidates by concentrating on theoretical knowledge as well as practical training. 

Know More About Vocational Course

Check top B Voc Software Development Colleges here. 

The main aim of this course is to give out skills related to Computer Science and Software Development. 

Bachelor of Vocational Studies is a practical and skill-oriented program which focuses on important practical knowledge along with theoretical knowledge. 

Students who have passed Class 12 in Science stream from a recognized board are eligible to apply for admission to the B Voc Software Development course. Almost all the top engineering institutes in the country admit students on the basis of entrance examinations like IPU CET and CUCET. There is also a round of counseling held after qualifying the entrance examinations.

Some of the top B Voc Software Development institutes, as rated by NIRF 2020 are as follows.

NIRF Ranking 2020 Name of the College/ University Admission Process Average Annual Fees Average Annual Salary
42 Kerala University, Thiruvananthapuram Merit-Based INR 10,800 INR 7,36,000
61 Ramanujan College, New Delhi Entrance-Based INR 27,740 INR 7,00,000
64 Alagappa University, Karaikudi Merit-Based INR 4,500 INR 5,00,000
90 St. Xaviers College, Mumbai Entrance-Based INR 7,355 INR 5,21,000
100 MZU, Aizawal Merit-Based INR 5,100 INR 6,68,000

There are a large number of government and private colleges/ universities that offer this course. The average course fees for the program ranges between INR 12,000 and 2,15,000. 

ALERT: CUCET 2020 results announced on October 17, 2020. Check further details here.

B Voc Software Development degree holders will be able to get hired in public and private organizations in positions like Application developer, Graphic designer, Website developer, Software tester, Coder, Algorithm designer, UI designer etc.

They usually get employment in areas like Application development, User Interface development, Software coding, Software testing, Software analysis.

The average placement package that can be expected by fresh graduates of B Voc Software Development usually ranges between INR 3,00,000 and 7,00,000. 

After completion of B Voc Software Development course, one can opt to enroll in MTech Software Engineering, MBA or PGDM, Law programs, Govt. jobs etc. Also check Top MTech colleges in India. 

Admission Process

What is the B Voc Software Development Admission Process?

The most popular engineering entrance exams in the country are IPU CET, CUCET etc. which are mandatory for admission into primarily public universities. Private institutes also conduct their own examinations or rely on the national/ state level entrance exams. 

The guide to apply for entrance exam based admission is as follows.

  • Step1- Registration: In this step, students need to create an account by entering basic details like email-id, phone number etc.
  • Step2- Application Form: Fill the application form with all necessary details. Care must be taken to ensure all details are accurate and correct.
  • Step3- Uploading of documents: Scan and upload all requisite documents like mark sheets, photograph and signature. Documents need to be uploaded in a specific format only, as specified by the institute’s application portal.
  • Step4- Payment of Application Fees: Candidates have to pay the application fees either online or offline. 
  • Step5 - Downloading of admit card: Admit cards are released once all applicants are judged for eligibility. The admit card must be downloaded and printed out to be used on the day of the examination.
  • Step6 - Entrance Exam: Prepare for the exam as per the syllabus and past papers. Appear for the examination on the date announced.
  • Step7 - Results: Results are announced after a couple of weeks of the exam day. If a candidate is successful in qualifying the entrance examinations, they can move on to the next round.
  • Step8 - Counseling and admission: Counselling is held for students who have cleared the entrance examinations. The student can now take admission in the B Voc Software Development course.
Eligibility

What is the B Voc Software Development Eligibility Criteria?

The eligibility criteria for B Voc Software Development  aspirants is not complicated and is as follows. It must be noted that the eligibility criteria will differ from institute to institute.

  • Candidates must have passed higher secondary or equivalent with an aggregate of 55% marks from a recognized Board
  • Candidates must not have any Compartment or Supplementary in any of the subjects.
  • Other than the above-mentioned criteria, various colleges have their own additional eligibility which the candidates must meet.
  • The candidates belonging to reserve categories should present their reservation certificate issued by the proper authorities.
  • The candidates must secure minimum qualifying marks in their Entrance Test for admission.

Is There Any Entrance Exam for Admission to B Voc Software Development course? 

A large number of Indian universities conduct entrance exams for B Voc Software Development admissions. The entrance exams conducted thus vary according to the respective universities. Some of the most sought-after entrance examinations are:

  • DUET: The Delhi University conducts Delhi University Entrance Test (DUET) for admissions to UG, PG, M.Phil, and PhD programs.

Check DUET Practice Papers here. 

  • CUCET 2020: CUCET is the entrance test for admission to the undergraduate and postgraduate courses offered by the various central universities of the country.
  • IPU CET 2020: The B Voc students who wish to become a part of the colleges under GGSIPU will have to appear for IPU CET. Click here to download IPU CET Practice Papers. 

The important dates of these exams are given below : 

Exam Name  Mode of Exam  Application Period  Exam Date Result Date
DUET 2020 Online  May 2020 - August 31, 2020 September 6 - 11, 2020 October 14, 2020
IPU CET 2020 Online March 03 - August 11, 2020 September 9 - 14, 2020 October 8, 2020
CUCET 2020 Offline March 16 - June 06, 2020 September 18 - 20, 2020 October 17, 2020
How to prepare for entrance exam

How to prepare for B Voc Software Development entrance examinations?

Candidates preparing for any of the above-mentioned entrance examinations are advised to take note of the preparation tips given below:

  • Be thorough with the syllabus. Most Engineering Entrances cover the subjects of Chemistry, Maths, and Physics. Candidates seeking a good score are advised to study according to the topics to efficiently keep track of their progress and manage time properly. 
  • Decide on Exam Preparation material early, and stick to the decided Textbooks/ Prep Material throughout their study. This will help the student avoid confusion, especially towards the end. 
  • Practice with Previous Year’s Papers. This is the best way to become completely familiar with both the content and format of the examination. Practicing will also improve the student’s speed in completing the tougher sections. It will highlight the areas that require additional focus and preparation. 

How to get admission in a good B Voc Software Development college?

To secure admission into a top-ranked B Voc Software Development college, a number of factors come into play. Some of the following tips will be helpful in that regard.

  • Be aware of the types of questions and the difficulty level of the questions asked in different entrance exams. Some papers are comparatively easier to attempt than the others. This will help in better preparation.
  • Since questions are asked from the syllabus covered at the 10+2 level of schooling, going over the material and notes would be sufficient. Revision of all basic concepts must be done.
  • Some papers have an English section and an Aptitude section. Preparation for these sections can be by practicing past papers.
  • Be aware of all dates and deadlines. Examination application dates, exam dates etc. are changed and advertised in all major newspapers. It is important to keep track of any such news.
  • Take a look at the daily news and affairs of the world regularly. Keeping up to date with the news will help in preparation for the exam and counseling round but also act as a break from studying.
Details about Course

B Voc Software Development: What is it about?

Information and details about the B Voc Software Development program are as follows.

  • Bachelor of Vocational Studies in Software Development is a course which usually focuses on a skill development programme which concentrates on both theoretical and practical knowledge
  • It includes extensive training and practical experience in software development and computer science
  • This course is made for those students who wish to improve and skills and expertise and earn a decent salaried job.
  • In this course internship sessions are mandatory in various colleges which collaborates with many recognized industries such as Ashok Leyland etc.
  • The students are given a real time practical session to improve their skills in the software department
  • The students are trained with good skills, practical & theoretical knowledge, expertise and experience which helps them for a better future.

Why Study B Voc Software Development? (h3)

Some of the reasons to pursue this course are as follows.

  • Bachelor of Vocational Studies in Software Development course increases the practical knowledge about computer science.
  • This course includes various internships and practical applications that helps the students in enhancing their knowledge about the industry.
  • There are wide options in this industry for these students and they can get jobs in various sectors such as the commercial industry, entertainment, technical service sector, IT sector and many more.
  • This course leads to a good salary package and future since the candidates become highly qualified and skilled.
  • These candidates become experts in their field and can enhance their skills by opting for a master's degree.
  • In this course, the skills exposed to the candidates are vast than the regular degree programs in a lesser duration
  • There is flexibility of the program as these candidates can pursue this course as long as they want for 6 months/1 year/2 years/3 years.

Job Prospects and Career Options

What are Job Prospects and Career Options after B Voc Software Development?

  • Software Developers can get into Government and Private Enterprises such as Application Development, User Interface Development, Software Coding, Software Testing, Software Analysis etc. 
  • There are ample job opportunities for B Voc Software Development degree holders in Government as well as Private sector. 

Some of the most common job profiles that a B Voc Software Development student can opt for along with job description and salary package are mentioned in the table below.

Job Profile Job description Average Annual Salary
Computer Operator The work of a Computer Operator is to find out the problems related to software and hardware of the computer and to solve the same. They also do the servicing of the computers INR 5,00,000
Website Developer A Website Developer designs, creates and to structuring of web pages that are to be displayed on a particular website INR 4,20,000
Graphic Designer The job of a Graphic Designer is to create multidimensional designers and graphics for apps, websites, promotions etc. INR 3,85,000
Software Tester The job of a Software Tester includes testing of user interface, applications and software in order to detect any problems, glitch or bug in it. They also helps in removing the problems accordingly INR 4,85,000
Professor A Professor is responsible for teaching those subjects related to the discipline of study of Software Development. They sometimes lead the department if they did academically well. INR 10,00,000
Application Developer The job of an Application Developer includes developing and coding of user-friendly apps for portable devices such as mobile phones, tablets etc. INR 3,20,000

Source: College Websites

What are the Future Scopes of B Voc Software Development?

B Voc Software Development degree holders can prefer to do jobs on completion of this program or can go for higher studies. The most popular choices of education on completion of a B Voc Software Development degree are as follows.

  • M Voc: After completion of B Voc Software Development course, candidates can opt for M Voc course. 
  • MTech: If one wishes to pursue studies in the same field of education, the first program of choice is a MTech Software Engineering. It is a two-year course and the eligibility criteria include having a BE or BTech in Software Engineering. This is one of the most popular masters engineering programs and admissions are highly competitive.

Check out the Top MTech Software Engineering Colleges in India.

  • MBA: A large number of engineering graduates choose to go for the management route by choosing to pursue a PGDM or MBA course. Admissions are offered through a national level entrance test. Having a BTech degree together with an MBA in a specialization of choice is highly advantageous and many organizations actively search for such candidates.

Check out top MBA Colleges and PGDM Colleges in India.

  • Competitive examinations: Another route that graduates can opt to go for is to prepare for competitive examinations. Examinations that are meant for job opportunities in Government sector organizations are most popular. Jobs are secure with assured high pay and regular increments.

FAQs

B Voc Software Development FAQs

Ques. What is the duration of the course?

Ans. The duration of this course is 3 years

Ques. How much score do you need to seek admission to this course?

Ans. You will need to score an aggregate of at least 55% in your Class 12 exam to take up this course.

Ques. Name some of the popular colleges that provide this course?

Ans. Guru Nanak Dev Institute of Technology, St. Xavier’s College, DAV College, JSS College, and Carmel College are some of the top colleges that offer B Voc Software Development course. 

Ques. How much do you need to pay to seek admission to this course in Indian Colleges/ Universities?

Ans. You will have to pay an average annual fee ranging from INR 12,000 to 2,15,000 to take up this course depending on the college or university you are applying to.

Ques. How much can you earn after completing this course?

Ans. You can earn around INR 3,00,000 to 7,00,000 per annum after you take up a job. However, as your experience and expertise grows, you are likely to earn more.

Ques. What is the admission process of the colleges or universities for this course?

Ans. You will have to appear an entrance exam and have to score good marks to come up in the merit list. Once the results are announced, you can apply in the colleges and universities based on the cut-off marks and the marks that you have scored.

Ques. What are the sectors where you can apply for a job after completing this course?

Ans. You can apply in the areas of application and web development, UI and UX Development, Coding, Software analysis and Testing, and many more.

Ques. Name some popular job positions that students can opt for after completion of B Voc Software Development course?

 
Ans. Some of the top posts that students can opt for on completion of this course include Application Developer, Web Developer, Software Tester, Algorithm Designer, UX and UI Designer and many more.

Ques. Who can apply for this course?

Ans. Students who possess an interest in software development and have skills of coding and programming can apply for this course.

Ques. What is the aim of this course?

Ans. This course aims at training the students practically and theoretically of all the domains that are included in the Software Development and Computer Science.

Campus Life :

There is an annual fest where all types of tournaments are held and there is a special event called josh too. The library is vast and books are in abundance. There are smart classrooms with LCD screens. Sports is promoted and there is various type of teams that have played on a national level. The quiz society has participated in many competitions and has won them. There are many societies including filming society, quizzing society, dance society, and entrepreneurship cell.

Placement Experience :

The placements are very good, Placement cell regularly organizes placement drives, and companies like ktmg, amazon, TCS are invited for the drive. A large population of students sitting for the placement drive get placed with a good package. Students can sit for internships in the second year. The highest package made in my course was 7 lakh per annum. About 93% percent of the students get placed.

Course Curriculum Overview :

The course equips a person with skills to develop software rather than bookish knowledge. There is a separate placement cell for the course. The faculty-student ratio is about 1:27. The faculty are very well educated and helpful to each and every student. Faculty teach with a lot of fun and there is an open discussion on every topic. The term exams are easy if studied properly.

7.3 /10

Placement Experience :

The companies that used to visit only came with job offers in sales, marketing and BPOs. The trend has very steeply changed because of the various departmental placement cells that are running individually and successfully. They are the reasons of attracting amazing job profiles like software developer, web developers, testers, content developers to name a few, that the students are eager to get their hands on. The companies are regularly kept in touch with and any internship or job interview offer is readily accepted but only after careful considerations to the job profile and other related aspects of the same. A meet is organised by the cell and the registered students take the interview and get the results generally in a week's time and rest depends on them. The companies are kept in record for future activities like these. Talking of the alumni network, it isn't developed as of now to it's utmost potential but is moving forward in the direction. Also, an internship fair organised by the college recently has also helped in improving the college's reputation which in turn is also an important pre-requisite in attracting companies to offer attractive profiles and try out the best of the talents that the college is nurturing. A few of the alumni students have also started working on Startups that are sure to be developed into something worth it. And why only the alumni? Students currently pursuing their studies, are also trying their luck in the startup industry.

Course Curriculum Overview :

The course is enriched into various levels or parts one can find while going for a computer science course. The course is different from it's counterpart courses in the amount of industry exposure that it provided to offer to it's students. It is majorly practical and everything can be taken to a ground level of you-can-do-it-yourself. Internships have become mandatory in each semester and the course has developed somewhat after careful learnings from the first batch of the course ever made in DU. As far as the faculties are concerned, many technical skills are taught by guest lecturers who come with considerable industry experience themselves. The GEC subjects (the ones that the university assesses us on) are taught by mostly permanent faculties. 1) Mr. Vipin Rathi comes with immense talent, experience and an upper hand in the industry and has always encouraged students to go beyond curriculums. A few students have also started devout learning in the Blockchain, AR, IOT etc technologies. 2) Ms. Varsha Joshi always had a way with students and presented herself to be a stunning perfection in whatever subject she taught all across the college. Her practical approach makes the subject not-made-for-cramming and thus her classes end up to be the most filled ones. By the constant efforts of university, college and the students the course is going to bear fruits in the near future.

College Events :

The college being new ( separated from Deshbandhu College in 2015) has started to pick up pace and now more people are aware of it. There are different societies that work in an organised fashion. Each society always has something bustling in there so the event calendar is always full be it for small or big events. And since at the end it is the Ramanujan College that we are the students of and want it to grow so at the end and action time you can see overwhelming number of volunteers ready to raise the flag high. And Thus you can always find everybody good in everything or something that can be used to make the event a hit. Considering the fame for this newbie college, the events aren't done on a very large platform but never get us stop rolling our eyes on its unexpected success. The events are growing and more and more crowd is pulled via extensive marketing techniques used by the fresh minds. The college is the home for the very famous RamCom events, Entrepreneurship Conclave, Diwali Mela, the first of it's kind Non-Teaching Staff Workshop (3 day), and Various such events that are gradually gaining popularity among the DU crowd.
